icontrol.drivers

Class TMCTL_Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • icontrol.drivers.TMCTL_Driver

  • public class TMCTL_Driver
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides access to the native code to access Yokogawa's TMCTL library.

    It uses Java Native Access (JNA) package to access the driver (tmctl.dll). The TMCTL library is only available for Windows platform.

    Usage:

    • Instantiate the class. This calls LoadNative to establish access to the native code (tmctl.dll).
    • Open the connection to an Instrument using Open. It clears the device (only for GPIB communication), assigns a proper value to m_DeviceID, and sets the TimeOut value.
    • To send/receive data use Send and Receive.
    • To receive Block-Data (e.g. to receive a waveform from an oscilloscope) use ReceiveBlockData
    • To close the connection to an Instrument call CloseInstrument.
    • Each communication with the TMCTL library checks the status of the last transaction using checkErrorTMCTL which throws an IOException if an error occurred.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    KPP (Kurt Pernstich: pernstich@alumni.ethz.ch)

      • RECEIVE_BUFFER_SIZE

        private final int RECEIVE_BUFFER_SIZE
        Size of the Receive buffer. Note that the entire response is read from the Instrument, this is just the size of one chunk of the Instrument's response

    • Constructor Detail

      • TMCTL_Driver

        protected TMCTL_Driver()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor. Initializes the Logger for this class and reserves memory for m_ReceiveBuffer. It calls LoadNative to load the native library.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When loading the native library failed (bubbles up from LoadNative).

    • Method Detail

      • LoadNative

        private void LoadNative()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the native library. Does nothing if the native library has already been loaded.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the native library could not be loaded.

      • Open

        protected void Open(java.lang.String Wire,
                    java.lang.String Address)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Opens the connection to the Instrument at the specified address using the specified communication port.

        Parameters:
        Wire - Chooses the communication protocol (USB, Ethernet, ...). Valid argument is USBTMC(DL9000). Further communication ports are easy to implement.
        Address - The address of the Instrument. The content depends on the value of Wire. For the DL9000 Series oscilloscope, the Serial Number must be specified.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When 1) an invalid Wire parameter is given, or 2) the Instrument could not be opened by TmcInitialize.

      • Send

        protected void Send(java.lang.String Msg)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the given String via the TMCTL library to the Instrument specified in Open and returns the number of bytes actually sent. If Msg is empty, the method returns immediately.

        Parameters:
        Msg - Data to be sent
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the transmission caused an error

      • Receive

        protected java.lang.String Receive(boolean Trim)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Receives data from the Instrument specified in Open. The response of the Instrument is read in chunks of size defined by RECEIVE_BUFFER_SIZE, but all available data is received. The received data stream is interpreted as a UTF-8 character set.

        Note that for oscilloscopes to receive waveform data, the specialized method ReceiveBlockData must be called.

        Parameters:
        Trim - If true, newline (\n) and carriage return (\r) characters are removed from the end of the returned String.
        Returns:
        The data bytes sent by the Instrument wrapped in a String.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the transmission caused an error

      • ReceiveBlockData

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer ReceiveBlockData()
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Receives Block-Data from the Instrument. Used for e.g. the DL9000 oscilloscope which sends the waveform data not via the regular TmcReceive method but requires block-transfer of the data. All the data available is read from the instrument, but it is read in chunks of sizeRECEIVE_BUFFER_SIZE.
        Returns:
        A ByteBuffer with the received data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When communication via the TMCTL library failed

      • checkErrorTMCTL

        private void checkErrorTMCTL(java.lang.String Msg,
                             boolean CloseConnection)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Checks the Status of the last TMCTL transaction (including TmcInitialize) and throws an Exception if an error occurred. If an error occurred, this event is also Logged in the GPIB-Logger.
        Parameters:
        Msg - This String is appended to the message thrown as an Exception when an error occurred.
        CloseConnection - If true, the connection to the GPIB board is closed when an error occurred.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when an error occurred during the last TMCTL operation

      • CloseInstrument

        protected void CloseInstrument()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the connection to the Instrument specified in Open. This method is called from Dispatcher.run after the Script has been processed and from checkErrorTMCTL.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the closing caused a TMCTL error
